main event: A pilot and co-pilot of a DC4 aircraft sighted an unidentified flying object shaped like a ball of fire trailing light near Akpatck Island, Newfoundland on May 20, 1956.
interesting points: The object was orange in color and estimated to be traveling at a speed between 600-1800 knots.
The pilot and co-pilot were certain the object was not a star.
The sighting lasted for 4-5 seconds before the object disappeared on the starboard side of the aircraft.
The visibility at the time was good with a scattered layer of clouds, but not complete darkness.
The report was forwarded to various military commands, including the Air Defense Command and the Air Technical Intelligence Center.
sighted object: a ball of fire trailing light
witnesses: pilot and co-pilot of a DC4 aircraft
